paper_abstract: We propose a (t, n)-threshold multiparty quantum-information splitting protocol following some ideas of the standard teleportation protocol [C. H. Bennett, G. Brassard, C. Crpeau, R. Jozsa, A. Peres and W. K. Wootters, Phys. Rev. Lett. 70 (1993) 1895] and Tokunaga et al.'s protocol [Y. Tokunaga, T. Okamoto and N. Imoto, Phys. Rev. A 71 (2005) 012314]. The sender distributes the classical shared keys to his or her n agents and each agent owns a secret key in advance. The sender's quantum information can be extracted by an agent subset by collaboration in such a way that at least t or more agents can get the quantum information with the mutual assistances but any t - 1 or fewer agents cannot. In contrast to the previous multiparty quantum-information splitting protocols in which the sender's quantum information can be recovered only if all the agents collaborate, our protocol is more practical and more flexible.
paper_title: THRESHOLD MULTIPARTY QUANTUM-INFORMATION SPLITTING VIA QUANTUM CHANNEL ENCRYPTION
